Some of the background details of this story are based, very, very loosely, on real events of the era in which this was placed. The story combines elements of fiction and fantasy with reality.
The operational details from the D-Day invasion are very real.
Other parts of this book are only imaginary.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: the beginning of Miyazawa Kenji's life, which includes his agriculture days and introduction to literature, and the second part which reflects on the ideology behind Miyazawa Kenji's work juxtaposed against Japan's recent political history.

Movie about two Australian girls--Debbie (Nell Schofield) and Sue (Sue Knight)--and what happens when they become girlfriends of two surfer dudes from Broken Hill in New South Wales. Taryn Simon is an artist who uses photographic essays to tell intricate stories about different themes. John Waters and Woody Allen are approximately the same age. John Waters was one of the first to take still life portraiture for the purpose of cultural criticism. Her use of art in a documentary format is extremely effective.
